dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our a cappella commentators, JOHN and GAIL.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Excited, Gail?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: If I weren’t, would I be wearing a diaper under this dress? As John speaks, we HEAR a marching band play.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Welcome back, a cappella enthusiasts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MILITARY BAND heads off stage as THE BARDEN BELLAS get

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m John Smith and sitting to my right is Gail Abernathy-McCadden- Feinberger.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: (pointing to wedding ring) This one’s gonna stick, John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well you saved the Jew for last.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: (gleefully nodding) I did, I did.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You're listening to Let’s Talk- appella, the world’s premiere downloadable a cappella podcast.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: We are coming to you live from our nation’s capitol where the Barden University Bellas are about to rock the historic Kennedy Center. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 2.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The BELLAS: BECA, CHLOE, Lilly, STACIE, CYNTHIA ROSE, JESSICA, ASHLEY and a small Latina girl, FLORENCIA FUENTE (FLO). Chloe nods at Beca, who blows the pitch pipe.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four... The Bellas SING: Icona Pops’s “We Got the World.”

dialogues.speaker: THEY SAY YOU'RE A FREAK WHEN WE'RE
dialogues.text: HAVING FUN... (song continues) This performance reflects a group at the top of its game.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: These ladies have broken down every barrier in their path, haven't they, Gail?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: So right, John. The first all- female group to win a national title. Three-time defending champs. And now here they are performing for the President of the United States on his birthday. REVEAL: The PRESIDENT and FIRST LADY, who sit in a privat box [STOCK FOOTAGE]. SECRET SERVICE AGENTS stand guard.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Wow. What an inspiration to girls all over the country who are too ugly to be cheerleaders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bellas TRANSITION TO: Pitbull’s (feat. Ke$ha) “Timber

dialogues.speaker: WOOOOAH, (IT'S GOING DOWN)
dialogues.text: ON STAGE: Cynthia Rose steps up to rap. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 3.

dialogues.speaker: THE BIGGER THEY ARE, THE HARDER
dialogues.text: THEY FALL... (rap continues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies MASH “Timber” with “We Got the World.”

dialogues.speaker: BECA/BELLAS
dialogues.text: IT’S GOING DOWN/I'M YELLING

dialogues.speaker: TIMBEEER...
dialogues.text: Beca, killing it on stage.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: There’s Beca Mitchell, leader of the group. Flo does some BACKFLIPS across the stage. It’s impressive

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: good, but

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: International exchange student Flo Fuentes just earned her green card!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: She may need to do that flip right over the fence and back into Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: I think she’s Guatemalan.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh, none of that matters. The ladies continue their kickass performance. It’s a little noisy.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: There is so much going on on-stage, I don’t know where to look.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Couldn't agree more. Back in my day, we just sang. Maybe snapped our fingers if we were feeling frisky. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mash-up comes to an end, and they sing the last line “America the Beautiful.”

dialogues.speaker: FROM SEA TO SHINING SEA
dialogues.text: The ladies TRANSITION TO: Miley Cyrus’s “Wrecking Ball.” the rafters descends... FAT AMY! She wears a sparkly leot and sits in a harness with billowy white material flowing from her. She looks like an angel. As she descends:

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Wow! What a surprise!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: An overweight girl dangling from the ceiling. Who hasn't had that dream?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Lots of us!

dialogues.speaker: .--I CAME IN LIKE A WRECKING BALL
dialogues.text: As the song continues, each Bella grabs on to a piece of material attached to Fat Amy’s harness. It looks super co like something out of Cirque du Soleil. As Fat Amy spins thirty feet above the stage,

dialogues.speaker: AWAY/I WILL ALWAYS WANT YOU...
dialogues.text: During a move, Fat Amy FLIPS upside down, losing control. she tries to correct her position, her leotard rips at th seam with her back to the audience EXPOSING her BUTT CHEE The audience gasps! Thrown, the Bellas stop singing. Beca looks up in shock.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Goodbye innocence. BACK ON JOHN AND GAIL, who hold on to each other’s should (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 5.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: She has no underwear on. We have a commando situation! There is a commando situation on stage! ANGLE ON: A stern-looking President and First Lady.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Who is on top of this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TECH GUYS frantically hit buttons to try to prevent the impending situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balloons are RELEASED from the rafters, “Hail to the Chie begins playing over the PA. Upstage, an American flag UNF and a big birthday cake ROLLS out on a cart. ON STAGE: The harness TURNS Fat Amy very slowly so that s about to face the audience. Her arms are caught up in fab and she can't cover her privates!

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Take her back up already!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: She's turning. She’s turning --

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Oh my god, the children! Would somebody think of the children! John SLAPS a hysterical Gail across the face. ON STAGE: A Fat Amy is almost squarely showing her bits to the audien

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Avert your eyes or take it all in! You need to make a choice!

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Not the front! Nobody wants to see the front! The harness comes to a stop with Fat Amy FLASHING the audience with downtown full frontal. ANGLE ON: Reactions shocked anticipation from the Bellas, audience members, a John and Gail.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO MAIN CREDITS
dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 6.
A montage of clips featuring several NEWS PERSONALITIES covering “Muff-gate.” Some clips feature gifs of Fat Amy, hanging exposed with her downtown pixillated.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Mr. President. The Australian singer who calls herself “Fat Amy” gave the President a birthday gift from “down under” during last night’s celebration held at the Historic Kennedy Center. (turns to co-host) And if you’re wondering what I mean by down under, Chip. I’m talking about her vagina. She showed her vagina. To the President.

dialogues.speaker: TODAY SHOW HOST
dialogues.text: All eyes were on The Barden Bellas --

dialogues.speaker: JAKE TAPPER
dialogues.text: Three time defending national champions, which is a real thing... apparently.

dialogues.speaker: MSNBC REPORTER
dialogues.text: Although authorities have ruled out terrorism as a motive, The Bellas claim the mishap was merely an accident. And Fat Amy issued an apology--

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: (off paper) I am deeply sorry for the upset that I have caused. I feel I have already received punishment enough... in the form of silk burn. Exhibit C. As Fat Amy turns to show her butt burns,

dialogues.speaker: FOX NEWS PUNDIT
dialogues.text: It's filth. Women who sing are just another example of cultural decay due to loose morals--

dialogues.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH
dialogues.text: Not wearing underwear seems kind of intentional, don’t you think? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 All "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14

dialogues.speaker: MORNING JOE CO HOST
dialogues.text: Yeah, you either choose to wear underwear or you don’t wear underwear.

dialogues.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH
dialogues.text: That is a decision I make everyday.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY KIMMEL
dialogues.text: You know, until today, I thought singing a cappella was the most embarrassing thing you could do. ROSIE O’DONNELL (to The View panel) Usually those girls were on point but last night they were off point, off key, and their clothes on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE PEREZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I’d rather be in that limo ride home with the real President and he be like, “That shit was off the hook!”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 It's a new school year. We see a bustling college campus our Bellas coming together, heading toward somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chloe nervously paces in front of the Bellas.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Chloe, chill out. It was a mistake. They’re not gonna burn us for witchcraft.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: No, but right now, the people that run the I.C.C.A’s are - (points inside) in there with the Dean talking about us, and they think we’re a bunch of laughing stock-appellas!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (softly, re: pun) That’s awful. (then) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 8. All CONTINUED: All

dialogues.speaker: BECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, we've won three championships. Whatever happens in there, we'll be okay. Maybe it’s a sign to focus on other stuff.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: What other stuff?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You know, school, jobs... life.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: This group is my life. I’ve intentionally failed Russian Lit three times just so I could still be a Bella! Chloe drops into her chair.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the worst thing that’s ever happened to any of us! Flo pats Chloe’s back, and in her ever-optimistic tone:

dialogues.speaker: FLO
dialogues.text: You know, before coming to Barden, I had diarrhea for seven years. (pause) But yes, this is terrible.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. What’s the big deal, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: Um, you booshed-out our commander- in-chief.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, he’s not supposed to see that stuff because he’s Muslim.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Stacie, have you learned anything since you’ve been in college? An ancient-looking SECRETARY approaches the ladies, comic slow. Then, very judge-y...

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: The Dean is ready for you tramps. Try not to hump the furniture. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 9. CONTINUED: All Yikes. The Bellas file inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bellas stand in two rows as if on trial. Before them, stern-looking John and Gail sit behind a desk on either s of the DEAN.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Ladies, you have dragged the good name of Barden University into the gutter. And you’ve really upset these people, whose names I’ve already forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Nice intro, Seacrest.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Do you know who we are?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: You’re the National Association for the Advancement of A Cappella Performers.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That's right. And we’re concerned here at the N-triple A-C-P. Your little southern exposure in front of the Commander-In-Chief has irreparably damaged the entire institution of a cappella. Funding has dropped, sponsors are pulling out, Rashida Jones is denying ever being a part of it!

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: And the flood of complaints! (to Fat Amy) You would not believe the heavy flow caused by your vagina.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: You’re an adult. You know what you just said.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Unfortunately an example must be made. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: It is the decision of this governing body that the Bellas are hereby suspended from ever participating in competition at the collegiate level. A beat of shock as this new information sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Gasp!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (leans in, re: Lilly) Did she say something? Did the Asian say something?! John points a fancy pen at Lilly.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I will not be mocked! The Dean swipes the pen from John.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s my pen. I got it at Alcatraz.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: The terms of your suspension are laid out in this document. I’m sorry, but it’s over. 10. Then: A concerned Chloe takes the file from Gail. She opens and reads it.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Okay, can we be reasonable? Fat Amy apologized. It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Was it?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (off document, irked) You're taking us off our I.C.C.A. victory tour? Who’s going to sing the national anthem at the Puppy Bowl?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: You're being replaced by the European champions. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 11.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A German group whose skill is matched only by its professionalism.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: In other words, they’1l keep their pants on.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: So... We can’t defend our title, we can’t tour...

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: And you can’t hold any auditions. We don’t need your ranks to grow like a fungus.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: There’s nothing left. So basically The Bellas are over. The ladies look at each other, the grim reality sinking i

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This. is. an.... (emotionally singing)

dialogues.speaker: ACA-LAMITYYYYYYY
dialogues.text: Beca puts her hand on Chloe’s shoulder to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (sympathetic) I’m sorry that this disciplinary action has shocked you, especially since all of you are seniors. But the truth is, you’re just women. And you all be pregnant soon. Off their shocked reactions, we CUT TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY, a super-cute eccentric freshman, strolls arm-in-ar with her mother, KATHERINE.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Mom, I’m late. It’s orientation. You gotta let me go. Katherine, getting emotional, won’t let go of her daughte (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 12.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I can’t. I can’t do it. My only daughter, leaving the nest. Katherine leans into Emily, singing Chicago’s “If You Lea Me Now.” She has a beautiful voice. Emily loves it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: IF YOU LEAVE ME NOW/YOU’LL TAKE AWAY

dialogues.text: BABY PLEASE DON’T GO... DO YOU WANT

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You're gonna love this place. Just promise me you’ll call. (getting worked up) Oh and honey, don’t be afraid to express yourself. But not with those weird buttons in your earlobes, unless you want to work at an organic grocery store or indie coffee shop but then why am I paying for college?--

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Mom, slow down. I’m not gonna do anything crazy. I’m just going to write my songs and join ana cappella group.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Not just any a cappella group. Ignore what Lester Holt said, the Bellas are an institution. My days as a Bella --

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Were the best of your life, I know. And I can’t wait to be one -- unless they don’t take me? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 13.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh, they’1l take you. Thanks to me, you were born into it. (holds her cheeks) Then I’1l be your mother and your sister.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Gross. Okay -- Emily looks over at the church and takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And the next phase of my life... Emily takes a big, symbolic step away from Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Begins! (then, to a PASSERBY) Hi. I’m an adult now. (to another PASSERBY) I can’t wait to exchange ideas with you --

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Emily! Could you be any more embarrassing?! (then, loudly singing) OOH-OOH-OOH BABY PLEASE DON’T GO! Emily sweetly waves good-bye at her teary-eyed mother and enters the church. 12 OMIT (RENUMBERED TO All) 12 Al3 INT. DEAN OF STUDENT AFFAIRS OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER A The Bellas still stand before the Dean, Gail, and John.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Hold on... Wait a second... A long beat. Then, the Dean whispers to John and Gail.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: How long are we going to wait?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN/GAIL
dialogues.text: I got all day./We don’t do much. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 14. Al3 CONTINUED: Eyes wide, Al3

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Aha! (holds up file) There’s nothing in here that strips us of our I.C.C.A. title. And if we're still reigning champs... then we're automatically invited to represent America at the World Championships this Spring. the others look to each other.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: (commentator voice) Ah, yes. The World Championships of A Cappella. Where every four years, the best from all over the globe compete for world domination. (withering a little) I'm sorry, I feel like I have to be “on” all the time or people won’t like me.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: So this championship is like the Olympics?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Actually, a cappella competitions started the year before the first games in Athens. The discus was invented because they wanted something to throw at the singers.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: (aside to Chloe) Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: It might be. I’m failing history, too.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Good luck paying those student loans, Chlo.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Look, ladies. We can’t keep you from World’s competition, but it’s not going to help your case here.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Not at all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pitch Perfect 2" SHOOTING DRAFTS 5-11-14 15. Al3 CONTINUED: Al3

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: What if we win it? The Bellas perk up. John and Gail laugh, hard.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What if you win it? What if you win it? Like, you outperform the other groups. Ho ho! How do you fit such big dreams in such a small body? What if you win it? The two laugh even harder.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if you win it?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Yeah. If we win it, will you reinstate us?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: (through laughter) Sure. But no American team has ever won.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (proudly) That’s because they hate us.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: The whole world.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (through laughter) The whole world hates us! Off their continued laughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily sits among the FRESHMAN CLASS in a beautiful, old cathedral. An enthusiastic orientation REPRESENTATIVE addresses the room flanked by Barden cheerleaders.

dialogues.speaker: REPRESENTATIVE
